intro: Lassonia heptapeta, commonly known as the seven-petaled lassonia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its blooming period typically occurs during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
